title: 17-year-old shot during the holiday weekend in Westfield
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
WESTFIELD, Mass. (WWLP) – A man in Westfield will face a judge on Tuesday for accidentally shooting a teenager on Christmas Eve.
Westfield Police Sgt. Jeffrey Baillargeon told 22News a 17-year-old boy was shot in the leg on Sackett Street, Saturday, and taken to a local hospital for treatment. He is expected to be okay.
Sgt. Baillargeon said the suspect will be arraigned in Westfield District Court on the following charges:
Illegal Gun Possession
Assault & Battery with a Dangerous Weapon
Reckless Endangerment of a Child
Discharging a Firearm within 500 feet of a Building
His identity is not being released at this time.
